abstract_summ: Non-critically ill individuals with positive SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR tests were admitted between 7 February and 12 February 2020 to Dongxihu Fangcang Hospital in Wuhan, China . Fever (761 of 1012, 75.2%) and cough were the most common symptoms . Small patchy opacities (355 of 917, 38.7%) and ground-glass (508 of 9 17, 55.4%) were common imaging manifestations in chest CT scans . Diarrhoea emerged in 152 of the 1012 patients (15.0%) with a low incidence of diarrhoea, indicating the possibility of faecal–oral transmission .
